comp102x.assignment
Class GameView

java.lang.Object
  comp102x.assignment.GameView

public class GameView
extends Object

The GameView class represents the graphical components of the shooting game.

addMouseListener

public void addMouseListener(MouseListener listener)

calculateFinalFootballX

public int calculateFinalFootballX(double pan,
                                   int minPan,
                                   int maxPan)
Calculates the final x position of the football image by interpolation.

Parameters:
pan - the current pan angle of the arrow.
minPan - the minimum pan angle allowed for the arrow.
maxPan - the maximum pan angle allowed for the arrow.
Returns:
the final x position of the football calculated.

calculateFinalFootballY

public int calculateFinalFootballY(double tilt,
                                   int minTilt,
                                   int maxTilt)
Calculates the final y position of the football image by interpolation.

Parameters:
tilt - the current tilt angle of the arrow.
minTilt - the minimum tilt angle allowed for the arrow.
maxTilt - the maximum tilt angle allowed for the arrow.
Returns:
the final y position of the football calculated.

getGoalImageHeight

public int getGoalImageHeight()
Returns the height of a goal image. Assumption: all the goals have the same height.

Returns:
the height of a goal image.

getGoalImageWidth

public int getGoalImageWidth()
Returns the width of a goal image. Assumption: all the goals have the same width.

Returns:
the width of a goal image.

getloadedFootballX

public int getloadedFootballX()
Returns the x position of the football image loaded on the arrow.

Returns:
the x position of the football image loaded on the arrow.

getLoadedFootballY

public int getLoadedFootballY()
Returns the y position of the football image loaded on the arrow.

Returns:
the y position of the football image loaded on the arrow.

Hides the current football image.

replaceFootballImage

public void replaceFootballImage(comp102x.ColorImage newFootballImage)
Replaces the currently showing football image by a new image.

Parameters:
newFootballImage - the new shooting image to be updated to.

resetFootballImage

public void resetFootballImage()
Resets the current football image to be the football image loaded on the arrow.

showEndGameScreen

public void showEndGameScreen()
Shows the end game screen.

showExplosionImage

public void showExplosionImage(int row,
                               int col)
Shows the explosion image at a specific goal location.

Parameters:
row - the row of the goal.
col - the column of the goal.

showGameScreen

public void showGameScreen()
Shows the gaming screen, where playing can see the goals, arrow, football, ... etc.

showStartGameScreen

public void showStartGameScreen()
Shows the start game screen for a predefined time.

showStartScreen

public void showStartScreen()
Shows the start up screen of the game for a predefined time.

updateArrowImage

public void updateArrowImage(int x,
                             int y)
Updates the graphical representation of the arrow image, after the mouse has moved. This method updates the rotation, scaling and y position of the arrow image. It makes use of the canvas screen size and some parameters for interpolation and then update the image accordingly.

Parameters:
x - the x position of the mouse.
y - the y position of the mouse.

updateFootballImage

public void updateFootballImage()
Updates the position of the football image on the arrow after the arrow has been moved. This method make use of the current arrow position, scaling and rotation to update the loaded football image accordingly.

updateGoalImages

public void updateGoalImages(Goal[][] goals)
Updates the goal images according to the current status of the goals.

Parameters:
goals - a 2D array storing the goals and their status.

updateScore

public void updateScore(int score)
Updates the graphical score display.

Parameters:
score - the score to be displayed.

updateTime

public void updateTime(int time)
Updates the graphical time left display.

Parameters:
time - the time left to be displayed.
